sub_title: Research Assistant at Radboud University Medical Center, Department of Internal Medicine.
summary:
Seasoned epidemiological research professional with advanced statistical and clinical trial experience, 10 years in academia environment and over 5 years in public health engagements. Profound research concentration that focus on maternal and child health towards attainment of Millennium Development Goals (MDG) 4, 5, and 6. Solid knowledge in principles, processes and methods of demographic health surveys (DHS). Excellent skills in utilizing and execution of qualitative and quantitative epidemiological methods. Skilled in analyzing and interpreting massive database from population health records and translating a complex scientific information into prospects of public health policy.


Specialties:
Maternal and Child Health, Infectious Diseases,Iron Metabolism, Demographic Health Survey, Public Health Policy and Statistical Analysis.
Statistical tools: SPSS, SAS, STATA, ARCGIS, Graphpad, Sigma plot, Matlab and Simulinks, 
Word Processing: MS office tools (Word, Excel, and Power Point)
Media and Communication: Sound editing (ProTools, Adobe Audition, SoundSlides, Goldwave)
